Package uk.ac.ed.inf

Class Order

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.ed.inf.Order
public class Order extends Object
this class is used to store all the information about orders from the REST server, plus information about the outcome of each order

    void
    updateDeliveryCost()
    computes the cost, in pence, of all order items plus a charge of £1 (100 pence) per delivery, and updates the appropriate field also updates the order outcome accordingly (if an invalid pizza is found, if the pizzas cannot be provided by a single supplier, or if the total is invalid)
    static void
    writeOrdersToJson(List<Order> orders)
    this method is used to write the order objects for a specific date (inputted in the command line) to a JSON file

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order(String orderNo, String orderDate, String customer, String creditCardNumber, String creditCardExpiry, String cvv, int priceTotalInPence, List<String> orderItems)
      constructor for the order objects
      Parameters:
      orderNo - : the unique number used to identify an order
      orderDate - : the date the order was created/ placed
      customer - : the name of the person (customer) who made the order
      creditCardNumber - : the credit card number the customer used to pay for the order
      creditCardExpiry - : the expiry date of the credit card the customer used to pay for the order
      cvv - : the cvv security code number on the credit card the customer used to pay for the order
      priceTotalInPence - : the total price of all the items included in the order
      orderItems - : a list of all the items included in the order

  • Method Details

    • getOrderNumber

      public String getOrderNumber()
      getter method for the order number field
      Returns:
      order number (as a string)

    • getOrderDate

      public String getOrderDate()
      getter method for the order date field
      Returns:
      order date (as a string)

    • getOrderDeliveryCost

      public int getOrderDeliveryCost()
      getter method for the order delivery cost field
      Returns:
      the delivery cost of the order (including the £1 delivery fee if the order is valid)

    • getCreditCardNumber

      public String getCreditCardNumber()
      getter method for the credit card number field
      Returns:
      credit card number (as a string)

    • getCreditCardExpiry

      public String getCreditCardExpiry()
      getter method for the credit card expiry date field
      Returns:
      credit card expiry date (as a string)

    • getCvv

      public String getCvv()
      getter method for the credit card cvv number field
      Returns:
      cvv number (as a string)

    • getOutcome

      public OrderOutcome getOutcome()
      getter method for the order outcome field
      Returns:
      outcome of the order

    • getCorrespondingRestaurant

      public Restaurant getCorrespondingRestaurant()
      getter method for the order's corresponding restaurant
      Returns:
      restaurant to which the order was made

    • getValidOrders

      public static ArrayList<Order> getValidOrders()
      getter method for the list of valid orders for the inputted date (from the command line)
      Returns:
      a list of all valid orders for a given date

    • setOutcome

      public void setOutcome(OrderOutcome outcome)
      setter method for the order outcome field
      Parameters:
      outcome - the new outcome value that the class field will store

    • setRestaurants

      public static void setRestaurants(Restaurant[] restaurants)
      setter method for the static restaurants list based on URL inputted in the command line
      Parameters:
      restaurants - the list of restaurants available on the PizzaDronz app

    • updateDeliveryCost

      public void updateDeliveryCost()
      computes the cost, in pence, of all order items plus a charge of £1 (100 pence) per delivery, and updates the appropriate field also updates the order outcome accordingly (if an invalid pizza is found, if the pizzas cannot be provided by a single supplier, or if the total is invalid)

    • writeOrdersToJson

      public static void writeOrdersToJson(List<Order> orders)
      this method is used to write the order objects for a specific date (inputted in the command line) to a JSON file
